1.<if_woman>「さっすが <pc>！| 話の わかる女だぜ！<else>「: Way to go! You're a <if_woman>girl<else>guy<endif>|who knows what they're talking about!

2.<if_woman>「ロマンの わかる女だぜ！<else>「ロマンの わかる男だ: <if_woman>I'm a woman who understands romance!|<else>I'm a man who understands romance!|<endif>

5.「あの封印された書物は あたしと| <pc>さんが 見つけたんですよ。| ３人だ: It's not fair for the three of us to be|alone...

6.「フンッ。ようし いいだろう！| それでは チビのアカシを加えて| 改めて 若葉: Hmmm. All right, all right! So, with the|addition of little Akashi, we are once again|Formation! Leaf Explorers!

7.「よく聞け 隊員たちよ！| 我々の目的は この村の地下にあるという| 謎の部屋: Attention, men! Our objective is to discover|the mysterious God's Hall, which is located in|the basement of this village.

11.「すぐに 聞き込みに出発せよ！| 諸君らの はたらきに 期待しているぞ！: Go to the house to ask people in! We're|counting on you to do your job!

12.「へえ…… これが 知恵の社で見つかった| 封印された書物なのかい？: So... this is the sealed book found in the|Wisdom Altar?

13.「は はいっ！ ハジカ先生。| その…… 先生なら この本が| どれくらい古い物: Ha, yes! Mr. Hajika. I was wondering if you|could tell me how old this book is...

16.「……なるほど 状況は わかった。| 君たち探検隊の ヒントになるような助言が|: Well, I see where you're going. I don't know|if I can offer any advice that might help you|explorers, but...

17.「この書物に ほどこされていた| 封印の術式と 劣化具合から言って およそ| ３: The sealing technique used to seal this book|and the degree of deterioration suggest that|it is approximately 300 years old.

18.「……３００年前といえば このツスクルの村に| 学びの庭が つくられた時代のはず:
...300 years ago must have been the time when|the Garden of Learning was built in this|Tsusukul Village. Interesting coincidence,|
|don't you think?

19.「つまり……学びの庭が つくられたころには| まだ 神代の間が 使われていたって: Does this mean that the God's Hall was still|in use when the Garden of Learning was built?

20.「それにしても すごいじゃないか。| <pc>君といったか……| よく こんな本: Still, it's amazing. I don't know how you|found such a book, <pc>.

21.「はんっ！ こっちだって 負けてないぜ！ | 先生 見てくれよ！ これ コノタが: Ha-ha! We're not losing! Hey, Doc, check this|out! This is a very old, very nice love letter|Konota found!

24.「授業で習ったことなんですが……| ３００年前の 学びの庭の建設には| ある建築: I learned in class that a family of architects|was involved in the construction of the Garden|of Learning 300 years ago.

25.「一族の名は ドン家。 | ドワチャッカ大陸の ドルワーム王国に| 今も続く 名: The name of the family is the Don family. They|are a family of famous architects who continue|to this day in Kingdom of Dolworm.

26.「その ドン家を訪ねれば 当時の| 村の記録が 残っているかもしれません。| 神:
If you visit the Don family, you may be able|to find some records of the village at that|time. Maybe we can find out something about|
|God's Hall!

27.「どうです？ 名推理じゃありませんか？: What do you think? Isn't it a good guess?

28.「まあ 悪くないアイディアだ。| 隊員たちよ！ さっそくドルワームに出発せよ！|: Well, not a bad idea. Troops! Set out for|Dolworm at once! We're going to visit the Don|family, the architects!

29.「隊長は この学びの庭で 報告を待つ。| 諸君らの はたらきに 期待しているぞ！: The captain waits for your report in this|garden of learning. We are counting on you to|work hard!

30.「はいはい 偉大な建築家 ドン・パパチョなら| ワシのことだけども。ははあ……|: Yes, yes, the great architect Don Papacho is|an eagle. You're looking for the mysterious|room in Tsusukul Village?

31.「そりゃまた オツなことを してるねえ。| いいよ いいよ。昔の図面とか| なに: That's a very cool thing you're doing. It's|okay, it's okay. There must be some old|drawings or something left. I'll look for it.

32.「はい おまたせ。| これが ３００年前に描かれた| 学びの庭の 設計図さ。: Here you go. This is a 300-year-old blueprint|of the Garden of Learning.

33.「たしかに 当時 ツスクルの村の地下には | 神代の間って部屋が あったみたいだ: It is true that there was a room called God's|Hall in the basement of Tsusukul Village at|that time.

35.「昔 ツスクルの村の地下には| 迷宮が 広がっていたらしいね。| その奥に 神代: I heard that a long time ago, there was a|maze spread out beneath this village. Looks|like there was a divine room behind it.

36.「学びの庭は その迷宮の真上に建てられた。| そして 迷宮の入り口は| 職員宿舎:
The Garden of Learning was built right above|the labyrinth. And the entrance to the|labyrinth seems to have remained in the staff|
|quarters.

37.「それが ここ……。| 桜の間って呼ばれてる 部屋みたいよ。: This room is called the cherry blossom room.

39.「桜の間は…… 妙なウワサが絶えないから | 使われなくなったっていう| いわく: The Cherry Blossom Room... is said to have|fallen into disuse because of the strange|rumors that keep circulating.

40.「あ あの部屋だけは ダメだ！| あそこに行くのは 絶対ヤバイって！！| だって: Oh, no, not that room! It's definitely not|safe to go there! Because...! I saw it too.

41.「お…… 女の幽霊を…………。: Oh... a ghost of a woman...

42.「あははっ！ そんなの 見まちがいですよ。| そんなことより 神代の間の ありか: Ha-ha-ha! You're looking at it all wrong. But|that doesn't matter, we finally found out|where the God's Hall is!

43.「さあ はやく 学びの庭に 帰りましょう。| シシノタに 教えてあげなくちゃ！: Come on, let's get back to the Garden of|Learning. We must teach Shishinota!

44.「ないっ！ ないない！| たしかに ここに置いたのに| どこに いっちまったんだ: No! It's gone! I put it here, but where did it|go...!

46.「す…すまん コノタ。 | オレたちの宝が…… | ラブレターが 消えちまった。: I'm sorry, Konota. Our treasure... our love|letters... disappeared.

47.「ええええ～～！！ なんでだよ！| あんちゃんの アホンダラ！！| この スライ: Eeeeeeee~! Why the hell did you do that! You,|asshole! You Slime brain!

48.「うるせえバカ！ もう いいだろ。| 今じゃ 神代の間が ブームなんだから。|: Shut up, you idiot! That's enough. God's Hall|is booming right now. So...did you get any|luck with Dolworm?

49.「そうか そうか。でかしたぞ 隊員たち！| 職員宿舎にある 桜の間が 神代の間へ:
Oh, yeah, yeah. Well done, troops! So the|cherry blossom room in the staff dormitory is|the entrance to the underground labyrinth that|
|leads to the God's Hall.

50.「ダ……ダメだよ。やめよう あんちゃん！| あの部屋には 女の幽霊が 出るんだっ: N-no. Let's stop it, bro! They say there's|a female ghost in that room! I really saw it!

51.「ハイハイ お前のことだから| どうせ なにかと 見まちがえたんだろ。: Since it's you, you probably mistook it for|something, didn't you?

52.「諸君！ まずは 長旅ご苦労であった！| 君たちの優秀な はたらきにより| つい:
Gentlemen! First of all, thank you for your|long journey! Thanks to your excellent work,|the entrance to the God's Hall has finally|
|been revealed.

53.「諸君らの 功績をたたえ| これを授けよう。受け取れい！: In honor of your achievements, I give you|this. Take it!

54.「はっはっは。おどろいたか。| ちゃーんと報酬を 用意しておいたのだ。| これも: Ha-ha-ha. Surprised? I have prepared a reward|for you. It's part of being a captain!

55.「さて。まずは 長旅の疲れを いやすがよい。| 充分に休んだら また探検に出発し:
First of all, you should recover from the|the fatigue of your long journey. After you've|had enough rest, let's go exploring again!|
|Dismissed!

56.「ちがうんだ…… ちがうんだよ。| オイラ 本当に 幽霊を見たんだ……。: No, no, no, no. I really did see a ghost...

57.「あの雨の日……オイラは| 授業をサボって 昼寝でもしようと思って| 桜の間に: That rainy day... I decided to skip class and|take a nap, so I walked up to the cherry|blossom trees.

58.「そしたら その時 ちょうど雷が落ちて……: And just then, a bolt of lightning struck...

59.「窓に 白い女の顔が| 浮かんでるのが 見えたんだ……。: I saw a white woman's face floating in the|window.
